_comment: TEMPLATE: Footer Configuration - Copy this file and rename it to '[viewname]-footer.json'
_description: Configure aggregate calculations displayed in the table footer (summary row at bottom).
_usage: Enable footer and define aggregation functions for each column. Leave columns empty if no aggregation needed.

_options.enabled: true/false - Show/hide the footer row entirely

columns._comment: Count aggregation - total number of rows
columns.label: Total

_options.columnIndex: Zero-based index of the column (0 = first column)
_options.aggregation: 'count' - Count total number of visible rows
_options.label: Text prefix shown before the count (e.g., 'Total', 'Count')
_options.className: CSS classes for styling the footer cell

_options.staticText: The text to display (can be empty string '')

_options.aggregation: 'countUnique' - Count distinct/unique values in the column
'sum' - Add up all numeric values in the column
'average' or 'avg' - Calculate mean of numeric values
_options.decimals: Number of decimal places to show (default: 2)

_options.customFunction: Name of function defined in custom-handlers.js

_options.aggregation: 'none' or omit the column entirely - Leave footer cell empty

_aggregationTypes.countUnique: Number of distinct values in the column

_bestPractices: Use 'count' in the first column to show total rows
Use 'static' with empty string for columns that shouldn't have footers
Add 'fw-bold' to important totals to make them stand out
Use prefix for currency symbols ($, €) or units (#, units)
Test footer calculations with filtered data to ensure accuracy
Use countUnique for categorical data (types, categories, status)
Define columnIndex for every column, even if aggregation is 'none'

_exampleUseCases.financialTable: Use 'sum' for amounts, 'count' for transactions, 'average' for prices
_exampleUseCases.inventoryTable: Use 'sum' for quantities, 'countUnique' for product types, 'min'/'max' for stock levels
_exampleUseCases.analyticsTable: Use 'count' for total records, 'average' for metrics, 'max' for peak values
_exampleUseCases.simpleList: Use 'count' in first column, 'static' with empty strings for others
